section.section: The Board shall appoint a Procurement Advisor, who serves at the pleasure of the Board.

The Procurement Advisor shall:
have access to all books, accounts, records, reports, any material related to contracts and procurement, and all other papers and equipment necessary to carry out its responsibilities; and
have direct and prompt access to all heads of agencies involved in the expenditure of public funds.
The Board shall appoint a General Counsel, who serves at the pleasure of the Board.
The General Counsel shall be an attorney in this State.

The General Counsel shall:
have access to all books, accounts, records, any material related to contracts and procurement, and all other papers and equipment necessary to carry out its responsibilities; and
have direct and prompt access to all heads of agencies involved in the expenditure of public funds.

text.section: In accordance with the State budget, the Board may appoint any additional staff necessary to carry out its responsibilities under this Division II.
